definition: unimpressed with or indifferent to something because one has experienced or seen it so often before.
example: she was becoming quite blasé about the dangers

definition: the action or offence of speaking sacrilegiously about God or sacred things; profane talk.
example: he was detained on charges of blasphemy

definition: (of bad behaviour) done openly and unashamedly.
example: blatant lies

definition: (of an area of land) lacking vegetation and exposed to the elements.
example: a bleak and barren moor

definition: have a severely detrimental effect on.
example: the scandal blighted the careers of several leading politicians

definition: showing a casual and cheerful indifference considered to be callous or improper.
example: a blithe disregard for the rules of the road

definition: an attempt to deceive someone into believing that one can or is going to do something.
example: the offer was denounced as a bluff

definition: a stupid or careless mistake.
example: she stopped, finally aware of the terrible blunder she had made

definition: say (something) suddenly and without careful consideration.
example: she blurted out the truth

definition: talk in a loud, aggressive, or indignant way with little effect.
example: you threaten and bluster, but won't carry it through

definition: be a portent of a particular outcome.
example: their argument did not bode well for the future

definition: not genuine or true (used in a disapproving manner when deception has been attempted).
example: a bogus insurance claim

definition: a socially unconventional person, especially one who is involved in the arts.
example: Warhol and the artists and bohemians he worked with in the 1960s

definition: noisy, energetic, and cheerful.
example: a group of boisterous lads

definition: having a period of great prosperity or rapid economic growth.
example: the booming economy of the 1920s

definition: a thing that is helpful or beneficial.
example: the route will be a boon to many travellers

definition: rough and bad-mannered; coarse.
example: boorish behaviour

definition: unlimited or immense.
example: enthusiasts who devote boundless energy to their hobby

definition: large in quantity; abundant.
example: the ocean provided a bountiful supply of fresh food

definition: belonging to or characteristic of the middle class, typically with reference to its perceived materialistic values or conventional attitudes.
example: a rich, bored, bourgeois family

definition: withdraw from commercial or social relations with (a country, organization, or person) as a punishment or protest.
example: we will boycott all banks which take part in the loans scheme

definition: a person who boasts about their achievements or possessions.
example: braggart men

definition: wave or flourish (something, especially a weapon) as a threat or in anger or excitement.
example: a man leaped out brandishing a knife

definition: a bold manner or a show of boldness intended to impress or intimidate.
example: he possesses none of the classic wheeler-dealer's casual bravado

definition: physical strength in contrast to intelligence.
example: commando work required as much brain as brawn

definition: bold and without shame.
example: he went about his illegal business with a brazen assurance

definition: an act of breaking or failing to observe a law, agreement, or code of conduct.
example: a breach of confidence

definition: the distance or measurement from side to side of something; width.
example: the boat measured 27 feet in breadth

definition: concise and exact use of words in writing or speech.
example: the staff will edit manuscripts with a view to brevity and clarity

definition: hard but liable to break easily.
example: her bones became fragile and brittle

definition: survey goods for sale in a leisurely and casual way.
example: he stopped to browse around a second-hand bookshop

definition: abrupt or offhand in speech or manner.
example: she could be brusque and impatient

definition: a meal consisting of several dishes from which guests serve themselves.
example: a cold buffet lunch

definition: carry out (a task) clumsily or incompetently.
example: he bungled his first attempt to manage a group of professional players

definition: begin to grow or increase rapidly; flourish.
example: the city's suburbs have burgeoned, sprawling out from the centre

definition: move in an energetic and busy manner.
example: people clutching clipboards bustled about

definition: a structure of stone or brick built against a wall to strengthen or support it.
example: the cathedral's massive buttresses

definition: a collection of items of the same type stored in a hidden or inaccessible place.
example: an arms cache
